term.title: electron capture

item.text: A nuclear transformation in which the nucleus captures an orbital electron. Often the shell, from which the electron is captured, is indicated. (K-, L-, etc.).

sources.item: PAC, 1982, 54, 1533. 'Glossary of terms used in nuclear analytical chemistry (Provisional)' on page 1537 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198254081533)

term.citation: Citation: 'electron capture' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.E01980

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
